meanings.definition: To make or become black or dark in color.
meanings.sent1: The fire's smoke will blacken the walls of the house.
meanings.sent2: Leaving the bread in the oven for too long will blacken it.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally blackened my toast this morning, but it still tasted good.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds gathered, threatening to blacken the sky.
meanings.sent5: The ink spilled on the paper, starting to blacken the edges.

meanings.definition: To damage the reputation of someone or something.
meanings.sent1: Gossip can quickly blacken a person's name in the community.
meanings.sent2: The false accusations were meant to blacken his character.
meanings.sent3: The exaggerated stories only served to blacken the truth.
meanings.sent4: The scandal threatened to blacken the company's image.
meanings.sent5: The online reviews aimed to blacken the restaurant's reputation.
